com.golden.gamedev
Class OpenGLGameLoader

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  com.golden.gamedev.engine.graphics.AppletMode
                      com.golden.gamedev.GameLoader
                          com.golden.gamedev.OpenGLGameLoader
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.golden.gamedev.engine.BaseGraphics, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class OpenGLGameLoader
extends com.golden.gamedev.GameLoader

Extending GameLoader class for loading game with the support of OpenGL renderer using LWJGL or JOGL.

You must download LWJGL and/or JOGL library from its official site to use this class.
Download LWJGL library if you want to use OpenGL via LWJGL.
Download JOGL library if you want to use OpenGL via JOGL.
Or download both libraries if you want your game can be running in both mode.

LWJGL is available to download at http://lwjgl.org/.
JOGL is available to download at https://jogl.dev.java.net/.

Make sure the downloaded library is included into your game classpath before using this class.

Note: GTGE is not associated in any way with LWJGL and JOGL, this class is only interfacing LWJGL and JOGL to be used in GTGE.
This class is created and has been tested to be working properly using LWJGL v0.95 and JOGL v1.1b-08.

Example how-to-use OpenGLGameLoader : 

 public class YourGame extends Game {
        
        public static void main(String[] args) {
          <b>OpenGLGameLoader</b> game = new OpenGLGameLoader();
          // init game with OpenGL LWJGL fullscreen mode
          // 640x480 screen resolution
          game.setupLWJGL(<b>new YourGame()</b>, new Dimension(640,480), true);
          // init game with OpenGL JOGL fullscreen mode
          // 640x480 screen resolution
          //game.setupJOGL(<b>new YourGame()</b>, new Dimension(640,480), true);
          // init game with Java2D fullscreen mode
          // 640x480 screen resolution
          //game.setup(<b>new YourGame()</b>, new Dimension(640,480), true);
          // pick the graphics engine you like
          // in this example we pick OpenGL via LWJGL
          game.start();
       }
 }

See Also:
LWJGL official site, JOGL official site, Serialized Form

public void setupJOGL(com.golden.gamedev.Game game,

                      com.golden.gamedev.GameLoader.ScreenMode screenMode)
Initializes OpenGL JOGL graphics engine with specified size, ScreenMode, using vsync and window decorations by default, and associates it with specified Game object. Initializes graphics engine with specified

Parameters:
ScreenMode - If it is equal to 0, the game runs in full screen. If it is equal to 1, the game runs in Window mode. If it is equal to 2, the game runs in Dialog mode.
